headline: Quick Keto Chocolate Mousse
description: This keto chocolate mousse is so easy to make. No need to whip the cream, just mix all ingredients together and satisfy your sweet craving in minutes!

video.description: Chocolate lovers rejoice! This rich mousse is keto-friendly!
video.name: Quick Keto Chocolate Mousse

name: Quick Keto Chocolate Mousse
recipeIngredient: 0.25 cup powdered zero-calorie sweetener (such as Swerve¬Æ)

recipeInstructions.text: Beat cream cheese in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy.

Turn mixer to low speed and slowly mix in heavy cream and vanilla. Mix in sweetener, cocoa powder and salt until well incorporated. Turn mixer to high and mix until light and fluffy, 1 to 2 minutes more.
Serve immediately, or refrigerate for later.

review.reviewBody: I have tried so many KETO mouse recipes. This one is AMAZING and so fast and easy. Will be on the top of my keto sweets list!
I used 2 tablespoons of coconut sugar (stayed under my allotted carbs) and it was DELICIOUS.

I'm not on a Keto diet but thought I would try it and just use powdered sugar. The cream cheese should have tipped me off. It's not a usual ingredient in chocolate mousse and I was afraid it would taste like cheesecake. And it does. This recipe is not light and airy as mousse should be. And it took close to three times the amount of sugar to be the least sweet.
Quick and easy. I served it as a dip with pretzels.
This is amazing if you are craving something sweet. I have made it using sugar free strawberry preserves.
It was great!
Pretty delicious. We made a vanilla version for my daughter and she gave it a thumbs up.
Delicious! I added grated 90% cocoa bar to the mix. Use it as a frosting for my keto brownies.
Yum! Use it as a frosting for my keto brownies!
After 2 weeks of no sweets, this hit our craving out of the park. So easy to make and tastes just like a dessert you could get in a restaurant. Thank you for sharing
OMG so good
I love this mouse! It has just enough to satisfy. I served with fresh cut strawberries. Thank you.üòä

I love this recipe!! I‚Äôve made it many times! Super easy and loved by everyone that has tried it! One of my go-to desserts since being diagnosed diabetic! I‚Äôve even made keto peanut butter and this chocolate mousse and an almond flour crust and made a ‚ÄúReese‚Äôs‚Äù pie for Christmas!

Just do it!!!‚Äô It‚Äôs amazing and simple and ohhh sooo delish!! I‚Äôm gonna triple the recipe for a dinner party Friday. I know it will be a hit cus all my friends are counting carbs since i went keto!

I'd love to give this a good review but I can't. Mine ended up being almost grainy. I can't figure out why. I used liquid stevia and I sifted the cocoa powder. I also let the cream cheese warm up to room temperature. Any suggestions would be appreciated
This was excellent- I used monk fruit ( powdered sugar) and divided this recipe into 4 small helpings, and topped it with whipped cream. Perfect.

I think this will be an epic fail - mix until light and fluffy - mine did not do either. It's light and soupy..... I'm hoping the texture will thicken in the fridge?! It doesn't look even close to the video.
I followed the recipe exactly. It was wonderful.
So easy and so good! And it's CHOCOLATE! LOL
Easy and delicious!
I thought it was great for keto.. Instead of the sugar they call for i used 3 packets of stevia with Monk fruit .. not sure what that did to the recipe for carb count.. but it was good

I recently got into a low-carb diet and I have been constantly craving something sweet since it was my time of the month. I doubled the recipe and added semi-sweet chocolate chips and some peanuts and it tasted like smooth snickers. Not exactly how I would like to eat snickers but I'll take it. Definitely recommend this recipe!
OMG, I used black cocoa in this recipe, it is to die for! Chocolate craving, completely satisfied

Excellent. Got 3 quite adequate servings out of this, taking it to 4.6 carbs per serving.
Quick and easy recipe to put together.
Needed something sweet and easy. Had everything on hand. This did the trick!
I made zero changes and it‚Äôs absolutely amazing. It satisfies my sweet tooth while trying to stay keto!
I used monk fruit and stevia. Didn't like it. Had an aftertaste. Xylitol is the best option in my opinion. It's closest to sugar.
Rich and delicious
I made this with Ghiradelli 100% cocoa Dutch process and vanilla bean paste. I didn‚Äôt add any sweetener at all. It was really delicious.
I loved this recipe! I used the Swerve powdered sugar sweetener and dark chocolate cocoa and it was amazing! No aftertaste, very rich, and helps that chocolate craving with less guilt!
Amazing just as directed.
This is by far the Best Keto dessert I have made!! I did half vanilla flavor and half almond flavor. Certianly will be my go to dessert.

WOW, that is all I can say. I'm fairly new to Keto, and was only one month in, and really starting to crave sweets, and this was all I needed. It was hard to believe it was lo carb, but it is now going to be my go to dessert. I make a double batch and it keeps well for several days in the fridge. I rarely leave reviews, but had to with this one. Thank you so much for this recipe.
I used powdered allulose as my sweetener (no cooling effect, or aftertaste). 2 tbsp of cocoa powdered made it quite rich, so next time I‚Äôll add a little less chocolate, but it came out amazing!
Wow! What a lifesaver. I am new to Keto and was having a craving for something sweet. This totally hit the spot. I‚Äôm so happy.
Amazing, using it as a spread for my ‚Äúcloud bread‚Äù

Pretty good, super simple! This was almost TOO rich, if possible. I'm planning on making some unsweetened, whipped cream to cut it with. It's really thick, as the author said, so I think the extra whipped cream mixed with it would be perfect. I used Swerve for the first time with this. Taste was just fine. Recommended.
This was delicious!!! Made the recipe as is and used powdered bochasweet as my sweetener. So creamy and delicious. Non keto hubby and mom loved it!
This is a great and easy recipe! I tried freezing it like ice cream but it didn‚Äôt work well at all. Stick with it as is and it‚Äôs delicious!!
I substituted sour cream for the cream cheese, and I wasn't disappointed! It was delicious without the extra calories. Thank you so much!!
seriously bad aftertaste
I followed the recipe. This was the easiest, richest and all round best chocolate mousse I ever made.

This is by far the best Chocolate Mousse I have ever had. Not just keto. Ever! I used the recipe here. I added just about a teaspoon extra of cocoa. I also put my stevia and truvia sweetener in my ninja for about 20 to 25 seconds. (I didn‚Äôt have enough stevia so I used both) This powdered it up tremendously so the mousse was not gritty at all. I also used 2 tablespoons of avocado that I mashed up and blended with the cream cheese. It made it a thicker mousse and you can‚Äôt taste it at all. It was amazeballs! I could not tell this was keto at all! If you‚Äôre reading this and you already made it and didn‚Äôt have success. Try again and you‚Äôll love it! 
*I don‚Äôt use stevia other than for dishes like this on occasion
Excellent even with fat free cream cheese and half and half. I added a tsp of butter to make up for the lack of fat.

This mousse is excellent. My only concern is that the preamble to the recipe was a bit misleading, where it says "just throw everything into a bowl and mix", I took that part seriously, lol. After I did that, I read the instructions. My own fault as I'm not experienced at making desserts with cream cheese.
Oh my gosh, yes, this is good, and very rich. Like another reviewer noted, half of a serving is plenty. I added just a tiny "squirt" of raspberry puree right before eating. Fabulous!
i thought it was good, just not the best. needs a little more sweetness
Wonderful! So light and chocolatey.
It is pretty good, I did use Swerve and reduced the amount by 1/2. Also added an 1/8 t of cinnamon. Really gave it depth. Thx for sharing it
Loved this!! It tastes like chocolate cheese cake. So yummy!
Excellent flavor, sugar sub has a after taste. Good product.
I made no changes, only doubled it and I'm glad I did. Delicious.

1st time, as is, it tasted a little too cream cheesy for me. 2nd time I ran out of cream cheese, ended up using only 2-2.5 oz, and the cream cheese taste was barely noticeable. Lovely with chopped macadamia and/or pistachios on top!

Great recipe! We increased the cream cheese to 8oz and the whipping cream to a whole cup. 3tbsp of dark cocoa powder but only increased the swerve by 1 tbsp. It was not too sweet and was very creamy. We happen to love dark chocolate so this was perfect for us. We will do this one again.

Thanks for the base recipe! I used xylitol granular sweetener but put it through the bullet to make it powdered and I only used 1/8th of a cup which was plenty for me. It definitely hits the chocolate and sweet craving. It's true you don't need much, its filling. Delicious, thanks again!
This was thick and rich and yummy, I'll make this again

An excellent recipe. I have made this on 2 occasions and it was brilliant both times. I used erythritol and didn't have the issue some have complained of when using it. didn't crystallize in the refrigerator. i think its because of how long i whipped it for. I added a teaspoon of instant coffee to the vanilla before adding it to the whipped cream. I used one tablespoon hersheys special dark cocoa powder and one tablespoon hersheys 100% cocoa powder. I'll use a little less sweetner next time though. a tad sweet. I got 4 servings on each occasion I made this recipe. Keto or not I'll be making this recipe one of my regulars. Thanks for the amazing recipe.
Loved it!! Followed directions step by step and it was delish!! Even my 18 yr old liked it

Amazing!! Not the best photo lol. I will say I had issues with mixing the cream cheese because I don't have an electric mixer but I ended up using my blender. I added an extra tablespoon of coco powder and blended that with my monk fruit then added it to the mousse. Best keto dessert ever!!!
It was SUPER delicious and very satisfying. Its a keeper and very easy to make.
So easy to make and SO GOOD! I used dutched cocoa powder and added an extra tablespoon to make it extra chocolate-y!

I made this as an alternative to another version that doesn't use the cream cheese, but everything else. I found this recipe to be slightly heavier/greasier (not in a bad way), but also not quite as "harsh" of a taste on the tongue as the counterpart I have been making for several weeks now. It helps to satisfy the sweet tooth cravings, but I think the cream cheese flavor is a little too strong - it tastes more like a chocolate cream cheese frosting than a mousse.
It was absolutely amazing. My husband kept asking if I was sure this is keto!
Love this!!!
I used confectioners Swerve. It wasn‚Äôt sweet enough for me so I added more. It‚Äôs not as tasty as the real sugar mousse but I can live with it!
Oh this is Great!!!!
Awesome keto dessert. Made it for a date and he loves it too.
easy and awesome - what more could you ask for?
This was delicious and kit that craving for something sweet! I used Swerve (NOT Splenda) and there was no aftertaste. I could swim in a bowl of this for days on end!!
I can‚Äôt say anything more positive than 5 stars. I added half coconut extract and half vanilla extract, then garnished with a pinch of coconut.
This is good, reminds me a lot of frosting.
Perfect!
So yummy !

Horrible aftertaste, bitter and tastes of fake sweetener. I made it exactly as written. Too bad Splenda has been found to kill off gut bacteria because it would probably help this recipe a lot. Husband didn't mind it too much.

Y‚Äôall. I made it for Valentine‚Äôs Day. My twin and I ate it all. I made it again the next day. Added spices. Less chocolate. The original recipe has such a STRONG flavor and I didn‚Äôt want that until I didn‚Äôt haven‚Äôt like that. Stick with the original. It‚Äôs PERFECT. Quick and easy!!! When I get sugar cravings I‚Äôm ready to tear the house apart. Thanks so much for this!!!!!
Made recipe as instructed, excellent!!!

The chocolate mousse was delicious, exactly as written. I used another reviewer‚Äôs recommendation and layered this wonderful mousse on a ‚Äúcookie crust‚Äù of butter, swerve, cocoa and dash of cinnamon. Thank you for sharing your mousse recipe with us! Perfect!
Thanks! Finally found a keeper keto dessert! I doubled the recipe but not the sweetener. My husband doesn't like sweets much just a taste of chocolate.
Easy, fun, and super yummy keto dessert!
I used less sweetener, very yummy

This was very good! Good texture. EASY!! Next time I think I will try using lemon extract instead of cocoa (since I'm not a fan of chocolate) or maybe some extra vanilla. There will definitely be a next time:-)

My husband said it was too sweet and chocolately. 
I‚Äôll make it again reducing both.

My husband said it was too sweet and chocolately. 
I‚Äôll make it again reducing both.

Hubby and I just started the keto diet, today is first full day. I am playing with recipes to find what we like and don‚Äôt like. This recipe fits the bill, I will make again. We used straight monk fruit powder about 1/8 tsp and 4 drops of liquid monk fruit. Topped with fresh strawberries, hubby enjoyed thoroughly! Thank you!
I have made this every week since I made it the first time a month ago. On a keto diet and this completely satisfies my sweet tooth and chocolate craving! Great and EASY recipe.
I have made this every week since I made it the first time a month ago. On a keto diet and this completely satisfies my sweet tooth and chocolate craving! Great and EASY recipe.
I've been looking for an easy dessert for low carb diet and this is it! I just wish I had read the reviews for so I could have a cookie bottom too! LOL
It was so good!

Wow!! This recipe was delicious and easy!!
It tastes like chocolate cheesecake. 
I doubled the amounts of all ingredients and cut the sweetener in half. 
I did what another reader said and used Monk Fruit Sweetener. Must pulverize the sweetener in a coffee grinder. 
I was just amazed how good this dessert was!!
Can‚Äôt believe it‚Äôs only 6g carbs!

I love the versatility of this tecipe!! I always have a sweet tooth and this was awesome! I made exactly as recipe called for, double batch, and I loved it! I was concerned because I didnt have a mixer, but a whisk worked fine for me, thank you for sharing :)
Btw one serving is about 60g
Will make again. These measurements made well more than 2 servings for me

I made this tonight for the first time and it was very easy to prep ! I used xylitol, combined it with cream and stirred it with a fork to dissolve it a little before adding to cream cheese and worked out well. I will add a little more sugar next time but this will be my go to recipe for chocolate cravings. I had enough to fill 6 ramekins.
Absolutely delicious! I added a tablespoon of peanut butter.
I'll add less confectioners sugar next time (I used swerve) but it's delicious!
I skipped the salt, but kept everything else the same. It's delicious, and takes less than five minutes to make!
I was craving a Reese's Peanut Butter cup so I put a dollop of natural peanut butter on the side and yum

I was a little skeptical of this, because I really haven't had many keto desserts that I like! This recipe was easier than other keto mousse recipes I've found. It is SO good! It tastes like a mix between chocolate buttercream frosting and chocolate creme pie. This is going to be an easy dessert for me to whip up and take with me when I'll be tempted by holiday desserts at parties!
I made this before I was vegan and it was yummy!! Any person that is experiencing the Keto Diet, I highly recommend it!
